agent.speaker: agent
agent.text: It is important to note the primary sources are distinguished from secondary sources , which cite , comment on , or build upon primary sources .Normally, accounts written after the fact with the benefit ( and possible distortions ) of hindsight are secondary . A secondary source  interprets or analyzes primary sources. Also be a primary source depending on how it is used . For example , a memoir would be considered a primary source in research concerning its author or about his or her friends characterized within it , but the same memoir would be a secondary source if it were used to examine the culture in which its author lived. Both sources should b e be understood as relative terms , with sources categorized according to specific historical contexts and what is being studied . For instance, Documentary films can be considered a secondary source or primary source , depending on how much the filmmaker modifies the original sources depending upon the present state of knowledge within the field .

contexts.text:
Primary source
In the study of history as an academic discipline , a primary source ( also called original source or evidence ) is an artifact , a document , diary , manuscript , autobiography , a recording , or any other source of information that was created at the time under study . It serves as an original source of information about the topic . Similar definitions can be used in library science , and other areas of scholarship , although different fields have somewhat different definitions . In journalism , a primary source can be a person with direct knowledge of a situation , or a document written by such a person .
contexts.title: Primary source

|user|: primary sources in history
|assistant|: If you asking about History as an academic discipline, it is based on primary sources can include artifacts, documents, diaries, manuscripts, autobiographies, recordings, or any other source of information that was created at the time under study. They serve as original sources of information about the topic. Examples of primary sources in history include novels or plays, photographs, newsreels, coins, paintings, buildings, archaeological artifacts, oral reports, and interviews. Written sources may be divided into three types: documents such as official reports, speeches, pamphlets, posters, or letters by participants, official election returns, and eyewitness accounts; books, essays, and letters written by intellectuals; and religious texts and descriptions of religious ceremonies and rituals.
|user|: archaeological discoveries and colonialists
|assistant|: In fact archaeological discoveries helped to shaped the way European colonialists identified with the artifacts and the ancient people who made them . For instance, colonial Europe 's mission in Egypt was able to bring the glory and magnificence of ancient Egypt closer to Europe and incorporate it into knowledge of world history , putting that country  new spotlight . With the archaeological discoveries , ancient Egypt was adopted into the Western historical narrative and came to take on a significance that had up until that time been reserved for ancient Greek and Roman civilization . Also  , historians of the pre-Columbian period mainly interpreted the records of the European conquerors and the accounts of early European travelers and antiquaries .
|user|: Celts
|assistant|:  Archaeological discoveries suggests that the pre-Roman Celtic societies were linked to the network of overland trade routes that spanned Eurasia but scholars assumed that the original land of the Celts was west of the Rhine , more precisely in Gaul , because it was where Greek and Roman ancient sources , namely Caesar , located the Celts . This view was challenged by the 19th - century historian Marie Henri d'Arbois de Jubainville who placed the land of origin of the Celts east of the Rhine . Jubainville based his arguments on a phrase of Herodotus ' that placed the Celts at the source of the Danube , and argued that Herodotus had meant to place the Celtic homeland in southern Germany . The finding of the prehistoric cemetery of Hallstat in 1846 by Johan Ramsauer and the finding of the archaeological site of La Tène by Hansli Kopp in 1857 drew attention to this area .Archaeologists have also discovered large prehistoric trackways crossing bogs in Ireland and Germany . As the territory held by the Celts contained tin , lead , iron , silver and gold , they were metalworkers that created weapons and jewellery for international trade , particularly with the Romans .
|user|: Talking about the Celts, what is the importance of them in history?
|assistant|: Besides those areas of trade  that was mentioned before, the Celts were were considered a Central European Iron Age phenomenon , through the cultures of Hallstatt and La Tène . The Celtic languages were also important to form  a branch of the larger Indo - European family . By the time speakers of Celtic languages entered history around 400 BC , they were already split into several language groups , and spread over much of Western continental Europe , the Iberian Peninsula , Ireland and Britain . Additionally, they depict a pre-Christian Iron Age Celtic social structure based formally on class and kingship , although this may only have been a particular late phase of organization in Celtic societies . It is also important to note that the Celts depict a pre-Christian Iron Age Celtic social structure based formally on class and kingship , although this may only have been a particular late phase of organization in Celtic societies .

In fact, primary sources can be uses in many fields not just on literature field. Another examples of its use is in humanities.  A primary source could be  also defined as something that was created either during the time period being studied or afterward by individuals reflecting on their involvement in the events of that time . Additionally in the social sciences , the definition of a primary source would be expanded to include numerical data that has been gathered to analyze relationships between people , events , and their environment .  In the natural sciences , a primary source could be defined as a report of original findings or ideas . Primary source
A study of cultural history could include fictional sources such as novels or plays . In a broader sense primary sources also include artifacts like photographs , newsreels , coins , paintings or buildings created at the time . Historians may also take archaeological artifacts and oral reports and interviews into consideration . Written sources may be divided into three types .

contexts.text:
Primary source
In scientific literature , a primary source is the original publication of a scientist 's new data , results and theories . In political history , primary sources are documents such as official reports , speeches , pamphlets , posters , or letters by participants , official election returns and eyewitness accounts . In the history of ideas or intellectual history , the main primary sources are books , essays and letters written by intellectuals ; these intellectuals may include historians , whose books and essays are therefore considered primary sources for the intellectual historian , though they are secondary sources in their own topical fields . In religious history , the primary sources are religious texts and descriptions of religious ceremonies and rituals .
contexts.title: Primary source

contexts.text:
Primary source
Primary sources are distinguished from secondary sources , which cite , comment on , or build upon primary sources . Generally , accounts written after the fact with the benefit ( and possible distortions ) of hindsight are secondary . A secondary source may also be a primary source depending on how it is used . For example , a memoir would be considered a primary source in research concerning its author or about his or her friends characterized within it , but the same memoir would be a secondary source if it were used to examine the culture in which its author lived . `` Primary '' and `` secondary '' should be understood as relative terms , with sources categorized according to specific historical contexts and what is being studied .
contexts.title: Primary source

contexts.text:
Primary source
In historiography , when the study of history is subject to historical scrutiny , a secondary source becomes a primary source . For a biography of a historian , that historian 's publications would be primary sources . Documentary films can be considered a secondary source or primary source , depending on how much the filmmaker modifies the original sources .
contexts.title: Primary source

contexts.text:
Primary source
Whether a source is regarded as primary or secondary in a given context may change , depending upon the present state of knowledge within the field . For example , if a document refers to the contents of a previous but undiscovered letter , that document may be considered `` primary '' , since it is the closest known thing to an original source ; but if the letter is later found , it may then be considered `` secondary ''
contexts.title: Primary source

contexts.text:
Primary source
However , a primary source is not necessarily more of an authority or better than a secondary source . There can be bias and tacit unconscious views which twist historical information .
contexts.title: Primary source

agent.original_text: A secondary source is a source that interprets or analyzes primary sources. These sources are one step removed from the event or phenomenon under study. Examples of secondary sources include scholarly articles, textbooks, and encyclopedias that summarize and interpret primary sources. Secondary sources often provide context, background information, and analysis that can help to deepen understanding of the primary sources. In contrast to primary sources, which are original documents or objects from the time period under study, secondary sources are created later and offer an interpretation or explanation of those primary sources.
